p: Another pathway of vasorelaxation endothelium-dependent has been studied; it’s about the COX product: PGI2 which is recognized for its potential ability to relax vascular smooth muscle [90] via activation of second messenger cAMP [91]. Hence, the possible role of PGI2 seems to be ruled out, because the pretreatment of aorta with, indomethacin, the COX inhibitor, did not change the vasorelaxant effect induced by AcEO.
